definition: To be consumed or corroded gradually, often used metaphorically to describe the destructive effect of negative emotions or thoughts on a person's well-being or relationships.

examples.german: Der Zahn der Zeit hat das Holz zerfressen.
examples.english: The ravages of time have eaten away at the wood.

examples.german: Die Säure hat den Stoff zerfressen.
examples.english: The acid has corroded the fabric.

examples.german: Die Krankheit zerfrisst langsam seinen Körper.
examples.english: The disease is slowly consuming his body.
Envy is eating away at her soul.

examples.german: Die Zweifel zerfressen ihn von innen.
examples.english: Doubts are gnawing at him from within.
